text: COVID-19 vaccines reduce hospitalization and severe disease. Multiple studies from WHO and CDC confirm their safety and efficacy.
Masks are effective in reducing the spread of respiratory viruses, including COVID-19, according to CDC and peer-reviewed studies.
5G mobile networks do not spread COVID-19. Viruses cannot travel on radio waves or mobile networks.
Climate change is real and primarily caused by human activities such as burning fossil fuels. Evidence comes from NASA and IPCC reports.
Drinking bleach or ingesting disinfectants is extremely dangerous and does not cure COVID-19.
The Earth is round. Satellite imagery, circumnavigation, and gravity measurements confirm this fact.
GMOs are safe to eat. Scientific consensus from WHO and FDA states they do not pose a health risk.
Hydroxychloroquine is not proven to prevent or cure COVID-19. Clinical trials showed no significant effect.
Drinking water does not prevent COVID-19 infection. Good hydration helps health but does not stop viral infection.
Elections in democratic countries are monitored by independent observers to ensure fairness. Claims of widespread voter fraud are often unsubstantiated.
Flat Earth theories are scientifically incorrect. Observations from physics, astronomy, and satellite data support a spherical Earth.
5G towers do not cause cancer. Research by WHO and IARC shows no link between mobile networks and cancer.
Climate change is increasing global average temperatures, causing rising sea levels, and extreme weather events.
Autism is not caused by vaccines. Studies show no causal link between MMR vaccines and autism.
Eating garlic or ginger does not prevent COVID-19. These foods are healthy but not a cure or preventive measure.
The COVID-19 virus is transmitted primarily through respiratory droplets and aerosols, not through 5G or Wi-Fi signals.
Artificial intelligence cannot read minds or predict exact future events. AI analyzes patterns from data.
Climate change denial is inconsistent with overwhelming scientific evidence from multiple disciplines including meteorology, oceanography, and ecology.
Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies are decentralized digital assets, but they do not grant guaranteed profits and are highly volatile.
The COVID-19 pandemic started in late 2019 and is caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, a novel coronavirus.
The Moon's phases are caused by the portion of its sunlit side visible from Earth, not by Earth's shadow.
Spreading salt on roads during winter works by lowering the freezing point of water, not by directly melting the ice.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.
Shaving hair does not make it grow back thicker or darker. This is a common misconception.
The Mariana Trench is the deepest known point in the Earth's oceans, reaching approximately 11,000 meters deep.
Lightning can strike the same place twice. Buildings like the Empire State Building are hit frequently.
An apple a day does not keep the doctor away, but it is part of a healthy diet.
source: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health

text: Humans use much more than 10% of their brains. Brain imaging shows all parts are used for various tasks.
Chewing gum stays in the stomach for only a few days, not seven years. It is mostly indigestible and passes through the digestive system.
The average person does not swallow eight spiders in their lifetime. Spiders are not likely to crawl into a person's mouth while they sleep.
Vitamin C does not cure the common cold. It may help reduce the duration of symptoms slightly for some people.
The five-second rule is not a valid measure for food safety. Bacteria can transfer to food in an instant.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland. It was adopted for its symbolism of purity, innocence, and power.
A chameleon's ability to change color is primarily for communication and temperature regulation, not just camouflage.
Bumblebees can fly. Despite old rumors, scientific research proves they can.
The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States.
The first computer mouse was made of wood. It was invented by Douglas Engelbart.
There is no definitive proof of the existence of the Loch Ness Monster. All evidence has been inconclusive or proven to be hoaxes.
Polar bears' skin is black under their translucent fur. This helps them absorb and retain heat from the sun.
Coffee beans are the seeds of coffee cherries, not actual beans.
Albert Einstein did not fail mathematics in school. He was an excellent student in math and physics.
Bats are not blind. They have poor vision but use echolocation to navigate in the dark.
The Sahara Desert is not the largest desert in the world. The Antarctic Polar Desert is larger.
The 'Ring of Fire' is a major area in the basin of the Pacific Ocean where many earthquakes and volcanic eruptions occur.
The pyramids of Giza were not built by slaves. Evidence suggests they were built by skilled Egyptian laborers.
The first modern Olympic Games were held in Athens, Greece, in 1896.
The world's largest living organism is a fungus, Armillaria ostoyae, located in Oregon.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head.
Honey is the only food that doesn't spoil. It's preserved by its low water content and acidic pH.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
A crocodile cannot stick its tongue out. It is held in place by a membrane.
It is not illegal to refuse to pay for a taxi if you are being driven in reverse. This is a common but untrue myth.
The human body contains about 60,000 miles of blood vessels.
The first recorded use of the word 'OK' was in 1839. It stood for 'oll korrect,' a humorous misspelling of 'all correct'.
The tongue of a blue whale can weigh as much as an elephant.
